name: 'The Women of Qumar' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was name of the Rocky Mountain paper that had an article about the President being sued?
questions.explanation:
Rocky Mountain News.

	Katie brought up the question about the President, but it was Carol who finally told CJ the name of the paper was "Rocky Mountain News".

questions.text: Who told the President they should be more like him when handling guilt?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	The President felt that the women of the White House were giving him funny looks when he would send arms packages to different countries.

questions.text: Sam thought the President should come out with a National Seat Belt Law.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In answer to that, Toby told Sam maybe the President should set up a checkpoint on I-95. Sam said that it was impractical.

questions.text: What did the President say Modern History was like?
questions.explanation:
Television.

	Charlie was studying Modern History and the President told him to study the Crusades and the fall of the Roman Empire because Modern History was like television.

questions.text: Leo told the President the United States had a problem with what?
questions.correct: Possible outbreak of Mad Cow disease
questions.explanation:
Possible outbreak of Mad Cow disease.

	The President thought the United Kingdom had a problem with Mad Cow until Leo told him it was the US.

questions.text: What nickname does Amy have for Josh?
questions.explanation:
Special J.

	Amy and Josh knew each other in college. Mrs. Bartlet wanted Josh to talk to Amy about the UN treaty leaving out the word "forced" when discussing prostitution.

questions.text: Who did Josh make a joke about at a fundraiser that made Sam say he was going to apologize?
questions.explanation:
Rotarians.

	Sam was meeting with Tom Starks from the Democratic Leadership and Tom mentioned to Sam that Josh shouldn't have made the joke. Josh's joke was never told on the show.

questions.text: Who told Charlie when the Clean Water Act was passed?
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	The President told him the Clean Water Act was passed in 1972. He responded to a question Charlie asked him earlier in the day.

questions.text: What did CJ talk to Nancy about in the hall outside the briefing room?
questions.explanation:
Women of Qumar.

	CJ was getting angry at Nancy because the women of Qumar were being beaten and the White House was giving the country an arms package so that the US could keep their lease on the US military base in Qumar.

questions.text: Where was the meeting about the possible Mad Cow disease in the US going to be held?
questions.explanation:
Health and Human Resources.

	At the last press conference on the show, CJ told the press that USDA director David Rhinegold was going to give a statement at the Department of Health and Human Resources.
